resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

jonkeane commented on a change in pull request #11575:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11575#discussion_r742151481



##########
File path: r/tests/testthat/test-dplyr-funcs-datetime.R
##########
@@ -80,6 +80,25 @@ test_that("extract month from timestamp", {
       collect(),
     test_df
   )
+
+  skip_on_os("windows") # https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13168
+
+  compare_dplyr_binding(
+    .input %>%
+      # R returns ordered factor whereas Arrow returns character
+      mutate(x = as.character(month(datetime, label = TRUE))) %>%
+      collect(),
+    test_df,
+    ignore_attr = TRUE
+  )
+
+  compare_dplyr_binding(
+    .input %>%
+      mutate(x = as.character(month(datetime, label = TRUE, abbr = TRUE))) %>%
+      collect(),
+    test_df,
+    ignore_attr = TRUE
+  )

Review comment:
       Would it be useful/helpful/important to test a date column too?

##########
File path: r/tests/testthat/test-dplyr-funcs-datetime.R
##########
@@ -80,6 +80,25 @@ test_that("extract month from timestamp", {
       collect(),
     test_df
   )
+
+  skip_on_os("windows") # https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13168
+
+  compare_dplyr_binding(
+    .input %>%
+      # R returns ordered factor whereas Arrow returns character

Review comment:
       I wonder if this is a fact we should warn about?




--

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It'll be worth checking the other lubridate temporal extraction bindings to check if any others need extra arguments implementing too


{code:r}
library(lubridate)

dates_table <- data.frame(
  date = as.Date(c("1987-10-09",  "2021-10-26"))
)

dates_table_arrow <- Table$create(dates_table)

dates_table_arrow %>%
  mutate(
    month = month(date, label = TRUE)

  ) %>%
  collect()

# Error: Invalid: Function month accepts 1 arguments but attempted to look up kernel(s) with 2 

{code}
fields.summary: [R] Binding for lubridate::month() doesn't have `label` argument implemented
